acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 48-hour EC50 = 22.7 mg/L for crustaceans (Daphnia magna) (SIDS, 2007), the substance was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since its rabbit LD50 = 10000 mg/kg (HSDB (2005)), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Insufficient data available. Breathing air saturated with vapor for more than 1 hr produced deaths in rats (HSDB (2005)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Its rat LD50 = 2360 mg/kg (HSDB (2005)), which falls under the "Not classified" category based on the JIS classification criteria (Category 5 in the United Nations classification).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its classification for acute toxicity is Category 3, it is rapidly degradable (readily biodegradable, BOD degradability: 83% (Biodegradation and Bioconcentration of Existing Chemical Substances under the Chemical Substances Control Law, 1993)), and its potential for bioaccumulation is presumably low (log Kow = 0.4 (SRC, 2005)). Based on this information, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Its flash point is 66degC (Solvents Handbook, Ohmsha Ltd. (1994)), which is between 60 and 93degC.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Its autoignition point is 315degC (Ullmanns (E) (6th, 2003) vol. 30), which above 70degC.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Pulmonary dysfunction similar to asthma and airway hyper-reactivity have been reported (HSDB (2005)). However, due to insufficient information available, classification is not possible.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In eye irritation tests using rabbits, the substance is rated as 8 (on a scale of 1 to 10 according to the degree of injury, with 10 representing the most severe injuries) (HSDB (2005)). In addition, the substance is documented to be corrosive to human eyes (HSDB (2005)) and cause burn and irreversible damage (SITTIG vol. 2). Based on these documents, the substance was classified into Category 1. The substance is also found to be skin corrosive.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: This substance is reported to cause skin corrosion or burns in humans (HSDB (2005), SITTIG vol. 2). In addition, it is rated as C; R34 in the EU classification (EU-Annex 1 (accessed in November 2008)). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 1. As additional background information, propionic anhydride, in contact with water, produces propionic acid (ICSC (J) (2005)), which is skin corrosive (ICSC (J) (2005)). (Regarding propionic acid, see NITE ID926.)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance is corrosive to the respiratory tract, as it is to the skin and eyes (HSDB (2005)), and impaired pulmonary functions caused by inhalation exposure to the substance is documented (HSDB (2005)). In addition, the test substance-related cases of pulmonary edemas have been frequently suggested (HSDB (2005), SITTIG vol. 2, ICSC (J) (2005)). Based on these reports, the substance was classified into Category 2 (lung).
